abstract: The company pleaded guilty to misbranding its anemia drug Aranesp, meaning selling it for uses not approved by the F.D.A.
snippet: The company pleaded guilty to misbranding its anemia drug Aranesp, meaning selling it for uses not approved by the F.D.A.
lead_paragraph: The biotechnology giant Amgen marketed its anemia drug Aranesp for unapproved uses even after the Food and Drug Administration explicitly ruled them out, federal prosecutors said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Amgen Agrees to Pay $762 Million for Marketing Anemia Drug for Off-Label Use
headline.print_headline: Amgen Agrees to Pay $762 Million for Marketing Anemia Drug for Off-Label Use

byline.original: By Andrew Pollack and Mosi Secret
